briefdescription.para: Initialization parameters for the Generic Level Client model.

parameterdescription.para: Optional status message handler.

briefdescription.para: Generic Level Client model composition data entry.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a Generic Level Client model instance.

briefdescription.para: Get the status of the bound server.

detaileddescription.para: This call is blocking if the rsp buffer is non-NULL. Otherwise, this function will return, and the response will be passed to the bt_mesh_lvl_cli::status_handler callback.

parameterdescription.para: Client model to send on.
Message context, or NULL to use the configured publish parameters.
Status response buffer, or NULL to keep from blocking.
Successfully sent the message and populated the rsp buffer.
A blocking request is already in progress.
A message context was not provided and publishing is not configured.
The device has not been provisioned.
The request timed out without a response.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_lvl_cli *cli, struct bt_mesh_msg_ctx *ctx, const struct bt_mesh_lvl_set *set, struct bt_mesh_lvl_status *rsp)
memberdef.name: bt_mesh_lvl_cli_set

briefdescription.para: Set the level state in the server.

detaileddescription.para: This call is blocking if the rsp buffer is non-NULL. Otherwise, this function will return, and the response will be passed to the bt_mesh_lvl_cli::status_handler callback.

parameterdescription.para: Client model to send on.
Message context, or NULL to use the configured publish parameters.
New level value to set. Set set::transition to NULL to use the server's default transition parameters.
Response status buffer, or NULL to keep from blocking.
Successfully sent the message and populated the rsp buffer.
A blocking request is already in progress.
A message context was not provided and publishing is not configured.
The device has not been provisioned.
The request timed out without a response.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_lvl_cli *cli, struct bt_mesh_msg_ctx *ctx, const struct bt_mesh_lvl_delta_set *delta_set, struct bt_mesh_lvl_status *rsp)
memberdef.name: bt_mesh_lvl_cli_delta_set

briefdescription.para: Trigger a differential level state change in the server.

detaileddescription.para: Makes the server move its level state by some delta value. If multiple delta_set messages are sent in a row (with less than 6 seconds interval), and delta_set::new_transaction is set to false, the server will continue using the same base value for its delta as in the first message, unless some other client made changes to the server.
This call is blocking if the rsp buffer is non-NULL. Otherwise, this function will return, and the response will be passed to the bt_mesh_lvl_cli::status_handler callback.

parameterdescription.para: Client model to send on.
Message context, or NULL to use the configured publish parameters.
State change to make. Set set::transition to NULL to use the server's default transition parameters.
Response status buffer, or NULL to keep from blocking.
Successfully sent the message and populated the rsp buffer.
A blocking request is already in progress.
A message context was not provided and publishing is not configured.
The device has not been provisioned.
The request timed out without a response.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_lvl_cli *cli, struct bt_mesh_msg_ctx *ctx, const struct bt_mesh_lvl_delta_set *delta_set)

If multiple delta_set messages are sent in a row (with less than 6 seconds interval), and delta_set::new_transaction is set to false, the server will continue using the same base value for its delta as in the first message, unless some other client made changes to the server.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_lvl_cli *cli, struct bt_mesh_msg_ctx *ctx, const struct bt_mesh_lvl_move_set *move_set, struct bt_mesh_lvl_status *rsp)
memberdef.name: bt_mesh_lvl_cli_move_set

briefdescription.para: Trigger a continuous level change in the server.

detaileddescription.para: Makes the server continuously move its level state by the set rate:

The server will continue moving its level until it is told to stop, or until it reaches some application specific boundary value. The server may choose to wrap around the level value, depending on its usage. The move can be stopped by sending a new move message with a delta value of 0.
This call is blocking if the rsp buffer is non-NULL. Otherwise, this function will return, and the response will be passed to the bt_mesh_lvl_cli::status_handler callback.

parameterdescription.para: Client model to send on.
Message context, or NULL to use the configured publish parameters.
State change to make. Set set::transition to NULL to use the server's default transition parameters.
Response status buffer, or NULL to keep from blocking.
Successfully sent the message and populated the rsp buffer.
A blocking request is already in progress.
A message context was not provided and publishing is not configured.
The device has not been provisioned.
The request timed out without a response.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_lvl_cli *cli, struct bt_mesh_msg_ctx *ctx, const struct bt_mesh_lvl_move_set *move_set)
memberdef.name: bt_mesh_lvl_cli_move_set_unack

briefdescription.para: Trigger a continuous level change in the server without requesting a response.

detaileddescription.para: Makes the server continuously move its level state by the set rate:

The server will continue moving its level until it is told to stop, or until it reaches some application specific boundary value. The server may choose to wrap around the level value, depending on its usage. The move can be stopped by sending a new move message with a delta value of 0.

parameterdescription.para: Client model to send on.
Message context, or NULL to use the configured publish parameters.
